meaningMnemonic: With the right <radical>key</radical> you can unlock the <radical>sun</radical> to <kanji>yesterday</kanji>, or a <kanji>previous</kanji> day. The sun is in charge of the day changes, so if you use a key to unlock it, you can control the flow of time and return to yesterday, or a previous day in the past. Behold the power of the sun.
readingMnemonic: Time traveling to a <kanji>previous</kanji> time, like <kanji>yesterday</kanji>, can be rough on the body. As such, you wear a small <reading>sack</reading> (さく) to hold your valuables while you’re ripped through the sands of time. The sack keeps your important stuff from getting lost. The sack holds your key to the sun as well.
